title: Impact of Corporate Earnings Reports on Lockheed Martin Corp's Stock Price Movements

content.text: Lockheed Martin Corp released its Q2 2021 earnings report on July 27, 2021. The company reported a better-than-expected quarterly profit and raised its earnings outlook for the year. As a result, the stock price of Lockheed Martin Corp increased by 3.5% on the day following the earnings release.

On April 20, 2021, Lockheed Martin Corp released its Q1 2021 earnings report. The company's earnings exceeded analysts' expectations, driven by strong performance in its Aeronautics and Missiles and Fire Control segments. Consequently, the stock price of Lockheed Martin Corp rose by 2.2% on the day of the earnings release.

Lockheed Martin Corp announced its Q4 2020 earnings report on January 26, 2021. While the company's quarterly revenue was slightly lower than expected, it reported higher-than-anticipated earnings per share. Despite the mixed results, the stock price of Lockheed Martin Corp experienced a marginal decline of 0.7% on the day of the earnings release.

On October 20, 2020, Lockheed Martin Corp released its Q3 2020 earnings report. The company's earnings beat analysts' estimates, driven by strong performance in its Space Systems and Missiles and Fire Control segments. As a result, the stock price of Lockheed Martin Corp increased by 3.8% on the day following the earnings release.

Lockheed Martin Corp announced its Q2 2020 earnings report on July 21, 2020. The company's earnings exceeded expectations due to robust demand for its defense and aerospace products. Following the earnings release, the stock price of Lockheed Martin Corp surged by 5.5% on the same day.

On April 21, 2020, Lockheed Martin Corp released its Q1 2020 earnings report. The company's earnings surpassed Wall Street's expectations, primarily driven by strong sales in its Aeronautics segment. Consequently, the stock price of Lockheed Martin Corp jumped by 6.9% on the day of the earnings release.

Lockheed Martin Corp announced its Q4 2019 earnings report on January 28, 2020. The company reported better-than-expected quarterly earnings and revenue, supported by increased F-35 fighter jet deliveries. Following the earnings release, the stock price of Lockheed Martin Corp increased by 3.4% on the same day.

On October 22, 2019, Lockheed Martin Corp released its Q3 2019 earnings report. The company beat analysts' estimates, reporting higher-than-expected earnings and revenue. Additionally, it raised its full-year profit forecast. Consequently, the stock price of Lockheed Martin Corp rose by 2.1% on the day of the earnings release.

news.headline: UPDATE 2-Saudi Arabia to manufacture parts of Lockheed missile defense system
news.summary: U.S. weapons maker Lockheed Martin has signed agreements for Saudi Arabian companies to manufacture parts of its missile defense system, as the U.S. continues to conduct military operations in the Middle East against Iran-backed groups.  The sub-contracts for the Terminal High Altitude Area Defense (THAAD) system will enhance manufacturing capabilities in Saudi Arabia and transfer expertise to strengthen the country’s defence industry, Lockheed said in a statement on Monday.

news.headline: Saudi Arabia to manufacture parts of Lockheed missile defense system
news.summary: RIYADH (Reuters) -U.S. weapons maker Lockheed Martin has signed agreements for Saudi Arabian companies to manufacture parts of its missile defense system, as the U.S. continues to conduct military operations in the Middle East against Iran-backed groups.  The sub-contracts for the Terminal High Altitude Area Defense (THAAD) system will enhance manufacturing capabilities in Saudi Arabia and transfer expertise to strengthen the country’s defence industry, Lockheed said in a statement on Monday.

news.headline: Pentagon plans AI-based program to estimate prices for critical minerals
news.summary: The U.S. Department of Defense plans to develop a program to estimate prices and predict supplies of nickel, cobalt and other critical minerals, a move aimed at boosting market transparency but one that throws a new, uncertain variable into global metals markets.  The program, which received little attention after it was announced on a Pentagon website in October, is part of Washington's broader efforts to jumpstart U.S. production of critical minerals used in weapons manufacturing and the energy transition.  U.S. output lags market leader China partly because attempts to build new American mines can be heavily influenced by commodity price swings.

news.headline: UPDATE 2-US advances fighter jet sale to Turkey, Greece; Congress likely to approve
news.summary: U.S. President Joe Biden's administration on Friday formally informed Congress of its intention to proceed with the $23 billion sale of F-16 fighter jets to Turkey, taking a major step toward completing a long-delayed process that tested ties with Ankara.  The State Department sent the notification to advance the sale of 40 Lockheed Martin F-16s and nearly 80 modernization kits to Turkey, a day after Ankara fully completed ratification of the NATO membership of Sweden, a move that became directly linked to the jet sales.

news.headline: Exclusive-Lockheed Martin to cut 1% of its jobs in cost-cutting push
news.summary: Lockheed Martin will cut 1% of its jobs over the course of the year in a bid to cut costs and streamline operations, a company spokesperson said on Friday.  The reductions will impact positions across all of its business and enterprise operations, the spokesperson said in a statement to Reuters, adding that the cost-cutting actions will include hiring freezes and voluntary separations.  "We're driving cost reduction in our direct cost base through supply chain optimization, factory productivity and also on 1LMX-driven efficiencies," Lockheed Martin CFO Jay Malave said in the company's post-earnings conference call on Tuesday.

news.headline: Greece to get US draft letter approving purchase of F-35 jets - sources
news.summary: Greece expects to receive a draft letter of acceptance next week from the United States of its request to buy F-35 fighter jets, two Greek sources with knowledge of the matter told Reuters on Friday.  "The (Greek) defence minister will receive a draft letter of acceptance on Monday," one of the sources said.  Greece sent an official request to the United States for the purchase of 20 Lockheed Martin-made F-35 fighter jets in June 2022.

news.summary: Although the revenue and EPS for Lockheed (LMT) give a sense of how its business performed in the quarter ended December 2023, it might be worth considering how some key metrics compare with Wall Street estimates and the year-ago numbers.

news.headline: UPDATE 1-Defense firm Lockheed forecasts dour 2024 profit on supply chain woes
news.summary: Lockheed Martin forecast its 2024 profit below Wall Street expectations on Tuesday, as the U.S. defense contractor's  largest aeronautics segment that makes the F-35 jets faces supply chain disruptions.  U.S. defense firms are seeing a notable increase in orders amid escalating tensions between China and the Philippines, the ongoing conflict between Russia and Ukraine, and in the Middle East.  Lockheed said in October its production rate was impacted by low availability of processor assemblies, solid-rocket motors, castings and forgings, and its F-35 program had taken the worst hit.

news.headline: Lockheed Martin (LMT) Q4 Earnings and Revenues Surpass Estimates
news.summary: Lockheed (LMT) delivered earnings and revenue surprises of 8.82% and 4.96%, respectively, for the quarter ended December 2023. Do the numbers hold clues to what lies ahead for the stock?

news.headline: Defense firm Lockheed forecasts dour 2024 profit on supply chain woes
news.summary: (Reuters) -Lockheed Martin forecast its 2024 profit below Wall Street expectations on Tuesday, as the U.S. defense contractor's  largest aeronautics segment that makes the F-35 jets faces supply chain disruptions.  U.S. defense firms are seeing a notable increase in orders amid escalating tensions between China and the Philippines, the ongoing conflict between Russia and Ukraine, and in the Middle East.  Lockheed said in October its production rate was impacted by low availability of processor assemblies, solid-rocket motors, castings and forgings, and its F-35 program had taken the worst hit.

news.headline: Lockheed Martin Notches Solid Earnings as Global Conflict Rises
news.summary: Lockheed reported fourth-quarter earnings per share of $7.58 a share from sales of $18.9 billion. Wall Street was looking for EPS of $7.29 a share from about $18 billion in sales.

news.headline: Lockheed Martin Reports Fourth Quarter and Full Year 2023 Financial Results
news.summary: Lockheed Martin Corporation [NYSE: LMT] today reported fourth quarter 2023 net sales of $18.9 billion, compared to $19.0 billion in the fourth quarter of 2022. Net earnings in the fourth quarter of 2023 and 2022 were $1.9 billion, or $7.58 and $7.40 per share, respectively. Cash from operations was $2.4 billion in the fourth quarter of 2023, compared to $1.9 billion in the fourth quarter of 2022.
